thread.title: More victims of child abuse have come forward to give evidence than anywhere else
thread.title_full: More victims of child abuse have come forward to give evidence than anywhere else | Granada - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: More victims of child abuse have come forward to give evidence than anywhere else
text:
Home Secretary launches new national Child Abuse Centre in Greater Manchester Credit: ITV Granada The Home Secretary Amber Rudd has announced Â£40 million pounds to tackle child sexual exploitation during a visit to the North West.
A national Centre of Expertise is to be set up with Barnado's in Greater Manchester.
Amber Rudd said the centre will help the children who've been victims and she wants to see more abusers prosecuted.
The announcement comes on the day the Chair of the Independent Inquiry into Child Sexual Abuse was in Manchester to encourage more victims to come forward.
Despite its troubled start, Professor Alexis Jay is the Inquiry's fourth chair, victims say they're confident it will help safeguard children in the future.
One man's been telling Elaine Willcox about his years of abuse.
Play video
